headline: 'Getting closer' - Manchester United star shares encouraging injury update
body: Manchester United defender Lisandro Martinez has shared an encouraging update on his ongoing recovery from an anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) injury.

The Argentine centre-back has been absent since February after suffering the aforementioned injury blow in United's 2-0 defeat to Crystal Palace at Old Trafford. The 27-year-old was stretchered off with 82 minutes on the clock and was crying as he left the pitch.
The 27-year-old underwent a successful operation the following week and has since been working hard on his recovery. ACL injuries can typically take at least six months to recover from.

The defender, who joined United from Ajax three years ago, has been putting in the hard yards to boost his chances of making a comeback as quickly as possible. However, United are yet to confirm a potential return date.
Nevertheless, Martinez's latest update, which he shared on social media on Monday evening, was of a positive nature, writing on Instagram: "The comeback is getting closer."
Martinez's five-word post accompanied a video of him working on his physical strength in a gym. He was also donning United training wear.

The Argentine has struggled with injuries in the last couple of years, limiting him to just 46 appearances for United since the beginning of the 2023/24 campaign. In comparison, he made 45 appearances in his first season at the club in 2022/23.
Prior to suffering his ACL injury against Palace earlier this year, Martinez was just beginning to show signs he was getting to grips with the demands of head coach Ruben Amorim's 3-4-2-1 system.
As a ball-carrying centre-back, Martinez can help United progress the ball from deep areas of the pitch. Furthermore, the fact he is also left footed gives United an extra dimension.

headline: Bryan Mbeumo alternative, problem position - Bargain transfers Man United could make this summer
body: Manchester United are pushing to make their second signing of the summer after completing a move to sign Matheus Cunha. The current landscape of football transfers features inflated demands and eye-watering proposals, but there could be market opportunities for the recruitment team to capitalise on at Old Trafford.

Ruben Amorim faces an important pre-season as he looks to implement his philosophy on the squad after a difficult six months at the Theatre of Dreams. United face a difficult start to the season as they take on Arsenal, Manchester City and Chelsea before the beginning of October.

Following the narrow defeat in the Europa League to Tottenham Hotspur and their low finish in the Premier League, United are under pressure to get off the mark early with a strong start to the campaign.

United's rivals are all bolstering their respective squads ahead of another gruelling campaign but their focus will solely be on the Premier League and domestic cups after finishing outside the top eight.
But there could be some market opportunities this summer with players out of contract next summer and the time for their respective clubs to recoup a fee narrowing.
MEN Sport takes a look at some of the players, via TransferMarkt, that United could target to snap up at a discount price ahead of the final 12 months of their deals.
As well as the signing of Mbeumo, United will continue to press for an out-and-out striker and Dusan Vlahovic has been repeatedly linked with a move to the Premier League.
United missed out on the signature of Liam Delap but the 25-year-old Serb could be a target that can be landed at a discounted price to solve Amorim's problem position in attack.
Juventus won the race to sign the powerful forward, during a period when he was linked with a move to the likes of Arsenal and Chelsea.
Vlahovic would offer that physical presence that has been lacking up front.
During a period in United's history when their goalkeeping position is under so much scrutiny, the opportunity to sign Gianluigi Donnarumma could be one that is too good to resist.
A Champions League-winner with Paris Saint-Germain and a hero for Italy at the European Championships, the 26-year-old is entering the final 12 months of his contract in the French capital.
Andre Onana has been underfire for his string of high-profile mistakes last season and there have been further reports linking Emiliano Martinez with a cross-Premier League switch.

Although a move is largely unlikely due to his high ceiling and superb performances for Luis Enrique's side, should any uncertainty over his future creep in, he could be a revolutionary signing between the sticks.
With Lisandro Martinez's injury problems and Harry Maguire into his 30's, it won't be long before United are targeting fresh blood for their defensive structure.
They moved to sign Leny Yoro in a deal that signalled their intention to reinforce the backline.
One player who is out of contract next summer and facing uncertainty over his future is Marc Guehi.

The Crystal Palace captain has been the subject of interest from Liverpool but United, who beat the Anfield club to Yoro's signature last summer, could do worse than trying to test the Selhurst Park club's resolve.
Aged 24, experience with England and over a century of Premier League appearances under his belt, it would be a no brainer to not admire Guehi.

With Jadon Sancho, Antony, Alejandro Garnacho and Marcus Rashford expressing their intention to leave Man United this summer, should one or multiple leave, Amorim will be faced with a decision in the attacking areas.
Johan Bakayoko could be the ideal signing with Champions League experience and at 22, with his potential, a discounted deal for the PSV Eindhoven starlet might be an astute piece of business.
His services have been linked with the likes of Newcastle United, Liverpool and Arsenal in the past. Plus, he hasn't been shy to discuss his future previously.

"I definitely think that I can join Liverpool," Bakayoko said in January after beating Arne Slot's side in the Chapions League. "We can be happy that we won against big names, but they didn’t come with the strongest team either.
"It’s a shame that they didn’t come with the strongest team.
"I'm in a good place. I feel the confidence of the entire club.
"As long as that is there, I feel good, whether I play well or badly. I would not make such a move to Saudi Arabia now, no. I would not do it."
With United yet to finalise a move for Mbeumo, left-footed Bakayoko could be a bargain alternative.

headline: Bryan Mbeumo pre-season decision made amid Brentford to Man United transfer saga
body: Bryan Mbeumo has made his way to the United States this week as negotiations between Manchester United and Brentford continue for his signature.

The Cameroonian has been United's priority target for a month but, as of yet, no breakthroughs have been made. The Reds have seen two bids rejected and last week there was talks that a third bid was being prepared.

United remain confident they will eventually sign the 25-year-old but, for now, the wait continues. All this comes against the backdrop of both United and Brentford's players returning to pre-season training.

The Reds welcomed back most of their squad on Monday, including new signing Matheus Cunha. As for Brentford, they have seen only some of their players return to the training base with the squad coming back on a staggered basis.

It appears that Mbeumo's return will be later this month after he shared a picture overnight on his Instagram story in Beverly Hills, California. It appears to be merely a coincidence that the forward is in the United States a couple of weeks before United head out there for their Premier League Series tour.

United will be facing West Ham, Bournemouth and Everton in New Jersey, Chicago and Georgia as part of their pre-season preparations. As for Brentford, their plans have been altogether more difficult to nail down.

They are planning to travel to Portugal for a training camp this month and will play two friendlies in August against QPR and Borussia Monchengladbach. As things stand, it is unclear if Mbeumo will be joining them for those games.

Despite being in America, Mbeumo has kept himself across what is happening in west London having 'liked' a couple of posts of players returning to Brentford's pre-season. The transfer window shuts on Monday, September 1 at 7pm (UK time).

headline: Matheus Cunha and Diego Leon have just sent a transfer reminder to Manchester United
body: New recruits Diego Leon and Matheus Cunha met their Manchester United teammates for the first time on Monday as pre-season training commenced at Carrington.
The duo, who have joined the club from Cerro Porteno and Wolves respectively, were among the 15 players that reported back to the club's training ground for the first day of pre-season.
Head coach Ruben Amorim will be working with a larger group of players come the end of the week when those who were on international duty at the end of last season return to Carrington on Thursday.

United had hoped Bryan Mbeumo would have been part of their plans this week after tabling a second bid in excess of £60million for the Brentford attacker a fortnight ago. The Reds had set a target of signing him in time for the start of pre-season.
Unfortunately, that particular scenario has failed to come to fruition, meaning Amorim is set to work with just two new additions this week.

And with a crop of players not expected back until later in the week, Bruno Fernandes and Diogo Dalot being granted an extended period of leave after Diogo Jota's tragic death last week and five wantaway stars having their return dates delayed until later this month, it has highlighted the need for United to inject some pace into their recruitment drive.
No club should be pressured into getting deals done for the sake of it, especially United, who have been criticised in recent years for paying over the odds for countless players.
However, when you analysed the list of 15 players that were present at Carrington on Monday, it did hammer home the need to get new signings through the door sooner rather than later.

United have prioritised strengthening their attack this summer and getting Cunha nice and early last month marked an excellent start. However, the Mbeumo situation is beginning to drag on for too long.

With the likes of Chelsea, Liverpool and Manchester City getting deals done at speed this summer, United are at risk of being left behind. Sales remain key to bringing new players in, but the sight of just two new signings being in position for the start of pre-season has hammered home the importance of United adding more blood to their ranks sooner rather than later.
United have another fortnight until they jet off to the US for their pre-season tour, meaning the clock is ticking to get new signings in place in time.

headline: Man United boss' hands-off warning and message from £87m transfer target’s family
body: Manchester United are once again showing interest in Valencia's Javi Guerra, despite receiving a firm hands off message from the La Liga outfit two years ago.

Erik ten Hag, who was navigating his second full summer transfer window at Old Trafford, was keen to enhance the squad he took over following Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's exit and Ralf Rangnick's interim reign when he first expressed interest in Guerra in 2023. The 22-year-old midfielder has an £87million buyout clause that intrigued the United hierarchy, who were considering triggering it to secure the Spaniard's services.

Nonetheless, Valencia made it clear they had no plans to part with their prodigy, who progressed through Villarreal's youth ranks before transferring in 2019 and signing his first professional contract two years on. Valencia's sporting director Miguel Angel Corona told the Mail at the time: "We are fully aware that we have a player with enormous potential for the future and the ability to perform at a good level now.
"That is why the club have decisively moved him up to the first team in recent months. It is not in our plans to sell him to any club."

He added: "For us, the emergence of Javi Guerra has not been a surprise. We have been aware of what he is capable of for a long time, we have been helping him and demanding more from him every step of the way, from youth level to the elite.

"He has to continue working in this way. We have to be cautious when making assessments about his level or how far he will be able to go, as he is a young player and has a long way ahead of him, but only he, with his day-to-day work, will determine where his limit is."

Meanwhile, Guerra himself admitted in May 2023 that his family had urged him to remain at Valencia. He said: "They advise me to stay the same, not to change because all this has cost a lot of work and we have to continue like this."

The revelation came as a significant setback for Ten Hag, as well as Newcastle United's Eddie Howe, who were both reportedly keeping tabs on the promising youngster. Manchester United went on to sign Mason Mount from Chelsea for £55m and brought in Sofyan Amrabat on loan from Fiorentina.

Yet, it now seems that the Red Devils are back in contention to secure Guerra's signature. While United have been focusing on enhancing their attack this season, with the acquisition of Matheus Cunha from Wolves and interest in Brentford's Bryan Mbeumo, Ruben Amorim is also keen on reinforcing the midfield.

According to Italian media reports, Guerra is edging closer to swapping the Spanish sun for the north west of England. Despite his substantial release clause, United might attempt to negotiate a more affordable deal for the talent, considering their potentially hefty spending this summer and the array of other targets they have across the pitch.

With Christian Eriksen leaving and Casemiro's playing time at Old Trafford uncertain, Amorim might be considering a younger squad to fit his preferred 3-4-3 formation. Guerra could potentially be an excellent addition alongside Bruno Fernandes and Manuel Ugarte, especially as Kobbie Mainoo's position in the starting line-up is doubtful due to his struggles with Amorim's style.

Last season, Guerra made a strong impression in La Liga, netting three goals and providing three assists in 36 appearances for Valencia, who finished a respectable 12th in the league. With United ending a record-low 15th in the Premier League, Amorim will undoubtedly be keen to bring more stability and control to the midfield ahead of the next season.

headline: Manchester United set 'tight' deadline to complete £44.8m transfer Ruben Amorim needs
body: Manchester United have been informed they have a week to complete the signing of Fiorentina centre-forward Moise Kean this summer - if they wish to do so.
The former Everton man had a difficult time in the Premier League during his first stint in the English top-flight. He scored just four goals in 39 appearances for the Toffees.

However, upon returning to Italy, via an initial loan to PSG and a second spell at Juventus, Kean has managed to rediscover the sort of form which made him such an exciting prospect. The 25-year-old scored 19 goals in Serie A last season - his best campaign in senior football.

This has, unsurprisingly, caught the eye of United and, according to The Athletic, the Reds have been the Premier League club most interested in Kean. However, if United are to snap him up, they will need to work quickly.

It is understood that Kean has a £44.8m release clause inserted into his Fiorentina contract. However, that clause expires on Tuesday, July 15 and if it is not triggered prior to then, the Italian club are under no obligation to accept a bid as low as that this summer.

Should they complete a move for Mbeumo, like to cost more than £63m, United's hands could be tied until they sell players. Marcus Rashford, Alejandro Garnacho, Jadon Sancho, Antony and Tyrell Malacia have all informed the club that they wish to seek opportunities elsewhere.
Now we have entered July, it is less of a necessity to sell before buying but Ineos will still need to bring in a good chunk of money before the window shuts to balance the books.
They attempted to sign Liam Delap before his move to Chelsea. A striker is very much on their wish-list - to act as competition for Rasmus Hojlund.

headline: Matheus Cunha and Diego Leon meet Manchester United teammates as stars return to training
body: New signings Matheus Cunha and Diego Leon were among the Manchester United players that reported back to Carrington on Monday for the start of pre-season training.

Leon finalised his move to Old Trafford last week, becoming the club's second signing of the summer, and was introduced to his new teammates on Monday morning, likewise Cunha, who arrived from Wolves last month.

United have welcomed their first crop of players back to Carrington for the start of their pre-season preparations and more are scheduled to report back later this week. It is understood those who went on international duty will report back on Thursday.
Bruno Fernandes and Diogo Dalot have been granted extended leave following the death of the Portugal teammate Diogo Jota, who sadly died last week after a car accident in Spain.

Meanwhile, Marcus Rashford, Alejandro Garnacho, Jadon Sancho, Tyrell Malacia and Antony were all absent amid their plans to leave Old Trafford. It is understood their return dates have been delayed until later this month.
Below, MEN Sport brings you a collection of images of United's players arriving back at Carrington for the start of pre-season training.
Cunha will be keen to hit the ground running at United after arriving from Wolves for £62.5million.
Young defender Leon completed his move to United last week, arriving from Cerro Porteno in his native Paraguay.
Heaven will be determined to continue building on his strong start to his United career this pre-season.
Amad was excellent for United last term, meaning he will have ambitions of building on last season's progress.
Goalkeeper Onana has reported back to Carrington with the ambition of remaining United's No.1 shot-stopper.
De Ligt experienced a frustrating end to his first season at Old Trafford because of injury issues.
Midfielders Collyer and Mount, who will have ambitions of enjoying a strong 2025/26 campaign, arrived at Carrington together on Monday morning.
Mainoo will be determined to get back to his best after a stop-start 2024/25 campaign that was disrupted by injuries.
Goalkeeper Heaton signed a new one-year contract at Old Trafford last month to stay at the club for another season.
Mazraoui enjoyed an excellent first season at United last term, meaning he will be keen to build on that success in 2025/26.
Young centre-back Fredricson will be hoping to continue his sharp progress after being handed his debut for the club last season.
Zirkzee will be hoping to impress in pre-season to boost his chances of being retained amid the possibility of him being sold this summer.
Shaw will be hoping for an injury-free campaign after a difficult couple of years.

headline: Five stars out, future hint and pivotal period - what to expect from Man United's return to training
body: Manchester United return to pre season training on Monday, but it will be five absent players who will garner the most interest.
The Reds will be back at Carrington as they officially start their build up to the new Premier League season which is now only five weeks away.

But wantaway five Marcus Rashford, Antony, Alejandro Garnacho, Jadon Sancho and Tyrell Malacia will not be among them. The quintet have been granted extra time away from the club as they seek moves away this summer.
New signing Matheus Cunha will be at Carrington as the Brazil international links up with his new club teammates for the first time following his £62.5million move from Wolves.
He is the sole addition to Ruben Amorim’s squad so far this summer with United continuing to work on a deal for Brentford attacker Bryan Mbeumo.

The Reds will hope to tie up a move for the 25-year-old in the coming weeks ahead of their first pre season outing against Leeds United in Sweden on July 19. Here’s four things to monitor as United get back to work.
Manchester United have launched their new home kit for the 2025/26 season with an Adidas shirt paying tribute to Old Trafford.
Fans can order their Men's, Women's and Kid's shirt today.
They won’t be there but the key to United’s squad overhaul will be what happens to the quintet who are no longer wanted and no longer want to be at the club.
With the exception of Malacia, United should be seeking sizeable fees for the remaining four and the sooner deals are done the quicker the money can be reinvested and replacements can be sought.
Rashford, Garnacho, Sancho and Antony should rake in £120million + and fund the United rebuild that is so desperately needed.
This is the time for Amorim. Having arrived last November, United’s domestic campaign was dismal and the gamble of focussing on the Europa League failed when Tottenham prevailed in the final.

Amorim knows the pressure will increase if United suffer a slow start to the season and it means work on the training pitch is vital. The old Trafford chief was short of time last term with a relentless fixture list but he’ll get plenty of it over the coming weeks and with no European football on the schedule for next term, Amorim will have the opportunity to right the wrongs of last season.
Pre season is often the time we see youngsters afforded opportunities to impress.

Amorim has shown he is prepared to offer chances to prospects with Chido Obi and Ayden Heaven regularly handed senior minutes in the latter stages of last season while Harry Amass and Tyler Fredricson also featured.

That quartet will have eyes on cementing senior squad spots over the coming weeks while there are several promising players amid the successful United academy ranks who will be harbouring hopes of making the step up.
Jack Fletcher, Sekou Kone and Bendito Mantato among others will be out to impress.
Matheus Cunha is the headline act of United’s summer so far.
Monday will see the £62.5million arrival join up with his new teammates for the first time. The hope is that the Brazil international will be able to revitalise United’s blunt attack.
The Reds still harbour hopes of completing a deal for Bryan Mbeumo with the forward keen to join but so far talks have yet to yield a breakthrough with Brentford.
Cunha will surely occupy one of the number 10 roles at Old Trafford and getting the new man up to speed as quickly as possible will be a key priority for Amorim this week.

headline: Marcus Rashford transfer latest as Barcelona decision presents Man United with another twist
body: Manchester United winger Marcus Rashford could be forced to miss out on his move to Barcelona following reports that the La Liga champions are planning to make another approach for Luis Diaz. The 27-year-old was one of five players to signal their intention to leave Ruben Amorim's side this summer, in order for pastures new.

Rashford joined Alejandro Garnacho, Jadon Sancho, Antony and Tyrell Malacia in wishing to explore new opportunities after they all spent time on loan away from Old Trafford last season. As a result, not only was Rashford's return for pre-season delayed but he saw his number 10 shirt handed to new signing Matheus Cunha following his move from Wolves.
Barcelona were said to be interested in Rashford over a possible move for the United academy graduate, however the exit path to join the Spanish giants looks to be closing.
According to Fabrizio Romano, Hansi Flick's side are said to be eyeing a move for the Liverpool forward Diaz.

Barcelona are reportedly not put off by the Anfield club rejecting an approach to sign him earlier in the transfer window and the reporter claims that they will return to the table in a bid to land Diaz.

The Colombian international is rumoured to be keen on the move to Spain's top-flight and it has been reported that he is their main target as a winger following Barcelona's failed pursuit of Nico Williams.
In a potential glimmer of hope for Rashford to join Barcelona, the club are said to be aware of difficult negotiations with Liverpool after two approaches have already been rejected.
Last week, AS reported that the chances of Rashford signing for Barcelona are slim, with the player's desire to join described as 'more of a wish than a reality'.
It has been said that Flick and sporting director Deco do not consider him as a priority with the club looking for a versatile forward who would be willing to make sacrifices.

headline: Man United told Premier League proven star available for £9m 'wants to join'
body: Manchester United have been told that Leicester City’s Wilfred Ndidi wants to join the Reds.

Recent reports from talkSPORT claim that the Reds are interested in Ndidi. The Nigerian international could be available for a cheap fee this summer following the Foxes' relegation from the Premier League.

The report also suggests that Everton are in the mix, with both clubs having shown interest in him last summer when he was available on a free transfer. However, Ndidi chose to commit his future to Leicester, signing a three-year contract extension after their Championship title triumph.

The agreement included a £9million release clause, which became active after the Foxes' relegation from English football's top flight was confirmed. And a close friend of Ndidi's, former Nigeria international, Julius Aghahowa, claims the player favours a move to United over Everton this summer.
“While Everton and Al-Ahli’s interest is obvious, Ndidi hopes to join Manchester United. He wants to take a step up by signing for a big club like Manchester United,” he said via Africa Foot.

“It would be an excellent move for someone I consider one of the best African central midfielders of recent years. He’s powerful, capable of pressing, winning back balls, and creating space with his long diagonal runs.”
The 43-year-old explains why Ruben Amorim would need a player like Ndidi in his squad.

He added: “Wilfred is the player the Red Devils need in midfield. He’s surprisingly generous and capable of repeating efforts and covering a lot of space. He would be a considerable asset to the Manchester club if the transfer were to go through."
Speaking back in January, then-Leicester head coach and former United striker Ruud van Nistelrooy provided an update on Ndidi's future after he was linked with a winter move to Ligue 1 side Monaco.

When asked if he would be willing to let Ndidi go, Van Nistelrooy said: "No, of course not. Wilfred is a key player and person in the squad and in the club and I’m glad he is nearly there to help the team again.
"We know how much we’ve missed him and we know we need him. Wilf is key in the coming months, a key part of this team that can get us out of this situation."

headline: Dominic Calvert-Lewin to Manchester United would say everything about Ineos transfer plan
body: Manchester United are being linked with a shock move for former Everton striker Dominic Calvert-Lewin.

The Reds' need for a new No.9 is yet to be reflected in their business so far. United have signed Matheus Cunha from Wolverhampton Wanderers and Diego Leon, while a move for Bryan Mbeumo is advanced - even though there is yet to be a breakthrough.

None of those players are seen as a striker. United's record of 44 league goals last term was comfortably their fewest in a generation and played a key role in their lowest top-flight finish since they were relegated in the 1970s.

It's why reports linking Calvert-Lewin with a move to Old Trafford will worry so many. While he may have the Premier League experience the Reds are clearly looking for this summer - being released by Everton should put him out of any consideration at M16.
Injury woes and a dreadful campaign at Goodison Park, which saw him score just three goals, highlight his decline. He may only be 28 but already it looks like his best days are behind him.

In fairness to United, it's still relatively early in the summer window for panic. The Reds would have liked to have made more progress by now, with Ruben Amorim's first-team squad arriving for pre-season training on Monday.

PSR (Profit and Sustainability Rules) constraints need to be considered, particularly when no sales have been made. It is also sensible for the club not to chuck money at players, as they were often accused of in previous windows.

But Viktor Gyokeres' likely move to Arsenal has left United with even fewer options in a summer when good-quality strikers are at a premium. Other players linked, including Victor Osimhen and Hugo Ekitike, are likely to be expensive, and there is no guarantee they would be keen on a move to Old Trafford.
It's too early to panic and yet as the new season edges closer, anxiety will rise and pressure will only grow before a campaign where the Reds must get things right.

headline: Marcus Rashford given clear Manchester United exit route after transfer update
body: Marcus Rashford's potential destination after Manchester United may have become slightly clearer after a recent update.
Rashford is continuing to be linked with a move away from United this summer following his loan with Aston Villa during the second half of last season.

Barcelona have been regularly mentioned as a potential destination for Rashford this summer in the event that a permanent move is agreed. After falling out of favour under head coach Ruben Amorim last term, it seems increasingly likely that Rashford's time as a United player will come to an end this summer.
A fresh update concerning Bayern Munich, though, may give Rashford hope that a move to Barcelona will become a reality.

Sport Bild reporter Christian Falk has stated that Liverpool forward Luis Diaz has informed Bayern of his desire to move to the Bundesliga club. Diaz has also been heavily linked with Barcelona this summer, but if the latest report is anything to go by, then a move to Germany is more likely for the Colombia international.

Should Diaz sign for Bayern, it would leave Barcelona still needing to sign a left winger. The La Liga outfit have already missed out on a move for Nico Williams after the Spain international put pen to paper on a new long-term contract with Athletic Bilbao.

As a result, Barcelona may now turn to sign Rashford this summer as a solution to their wide-forward search. Whether the Spanish giants would be interested in a loan or permanent deal, though, remains to be seen.

headline: Man United can unleash Bruno Fernandes and Matheus Cunha with clever £9m signing
body: Leicester City midfielder Wilfred Ndidi is "keen" to make the summer move to Manchester United, it has been claimed. He is available for a bargain fee this summer after the Foxes were relegated from the Premier League.

United expressed previous interest in Ndidi last summer, when they had the chance to sign him on a free transfer. Instead, he signed a new three-year contract extension to remain with Leicester following their EFL Championship title win.

However, the deal included a £9million release clause if the Foxes were relegated back to the second tier. As they finished down in 18th, picking up just 25 points from their 38 fixtures, he is able to leave for a cut-price fee.

Now, his friend and former Nigerian international - Julius Aghahow - has opened up on Ndidi's future and claimed that while there is interest from Everton and Al-Ahly, he hopes to sign for a "big club like United".
He said, via Africa Foot: "While Everton and Al-Ahly are clearly interested, Ndidi hopes to join Manchester United. He wants to take a step up by signing for a big club like Manchester United.

"This would be an excellent move for someone I consider one of the best African midfielders of recent years. He's powerful, capable of pressing, winning back balls, and opening up the game with his long diagonal runs."
Should Ndidi sign for United, he could well be the "dream" midfield partner for Bruno Fernandes. It is clear that the Portugal international prefers to drift forward and get into attacking areas.
As Fernandes is expected to be used as one of the two No.8s in Ruben Amorim's system next season, he would be allowed more license to go forward if he is alongside a defensive-minded midfielder.
Although Ndidi hasn't been at his best for a couple of years now, there is no doubt that, at one point, the Nigerian was among the best in the Premier League in his position. He is one of a kind.

Signed as a replacement for N'Golo Kante at Leicester, Ndidi made the No.6 role his own, protecting the back-four with his physical and technical attributes. He has the potential to impress for United.
A ball-winning midfielder, Ndidi's presence can help unleash the creative players - and afford them more freedom. Fernandes and Matheus Cunha are those that would benefit from Ndidi's arrival.
First, Fernandes would be allowed more room to manoeuvre in midfield and space to drive forward in attack, also knowing that he has Ndidi behind him and shielding the central defensive three.

As for Cunha, he would be given even more freedom to stay forward. Ndidi would cover so much ground in their midfield, leaving the former Wolves superstar with less responsibility in the middle third.
It is a deal that would make sense all-round. United would be getting a player with more than 200 Premier League experiences for a cut-price, bargain fee. At 28, he still has a lot to give.

headline: Bryan Mbeumo transfer latest as Man United 'move' for three alternative targets
body: Manchester United continue to pursue a move for Brentford star Bryan Mbeumo this summer.

The Reds return to training this week after securing two new signings. United triggered the £62.5 million release clause in Matheus Cunha's contract earlier this month, bringing the Wolves forward to Old Trafford on a five-year deal with an option for an additional year. The club have also signed Paraguayan left-back Diego Leon.

United's pre-season campaign kicks off against Leeds United in Stockholm on July 19. Shortly after their trip to Sweden, they will fly to the United States to take part in the Premier League Summer Series, where they will face West Ham, Bournemouth, and Everton.

There was hope at Old Trafford that Mbeumo will be able to join his potential new teammates ahead of a crucial pre-season for Ruben Amorim's team. However, a move is yet to materialise. Below is a round-up of all the latest news on Brentford's Cameroonian international.

Man United have been linked with several other players in recent days amid radio silence on the club's pursuit of Mbeumo. Dominic Calvert-Lewin, Javi Guerra and Wilfred Ndidi have all been linked in recent days.
Fabrizio Romano took to Instagram to spill the beans on United's pursuit of Mbeumo with a fresh update.

His post said: "BREAKING: Man United remain in active talks for Bryan Mbeumo, bid to be improved! Despite no agreement reached so far with Brentford, Man United keep talks ongoing remaining confident.
"With club-to-club negotiations to continue over final details for add-ons, fee structure and more to follow. Mbeumo has been clear: he wants Man United."
Romano's scoop has raked in over 413,000 likes, including thumbs-up from two of United's own players, Matheus Cunha and Joshua Zirkzee.
Mbeumo is supposed to have told both Brentford and Tottenham he's set on a switch to United if he waves goodbye to the Bees during the hot transfer period.

Spurs' interest in Mbeumo reportedly grew after Thomas Frank made the switch from Brentford to take the reins at Tottenham. However, according to The Athletic, Mbeumo has informed both Frank and Brentford that if he leaves the Gtech Community Stadium this summer, his destination will be Old Trafford.
Former manager Thomas Frank warned in May that Mbeumo's sale would need to be for a substantial fee.

"It is clear that if he is to be sold, it must be for a nice, nice amount," he said. "It is a lot. Mucho. Really a lot. Then it is clear that it is impossible to replace him one for one. It cannot be done.
"There is a reason why he costs x number of million pounds, and we do not have x number of million pounds to buy for."

headline: Chelsea leapfrog Liverpool on biggest transfer summer spenders of 2025 list
body: Chelsea are bidding to be the world’s biggest spenders in the summer window for the fourth consecutive season, and they are on course to do so…
All fees and figures are taken from Transfermarkt. The 20 biggest deals of the summer are here.

10) Tottenham – £60.52m
That’s a decent whack of money spent on Kevin Danso, Mathys Tel and Luka Vuskovic before Thomas Frank even gets a say.

9) Sunderland – £61.7m
The Black Cats made Noah Sadiki their third summer signing and are far from finished following promotion to the Premier League.

8) Juventus – £62.27m
Every penny has so far been spent on making loan signings permanent, with Nico Gonzalez their most expensive purchase.

7) Manchester United – £66.8m
They have completed one of the most expensive transfers of the summer so far with the capture of Wolves maverick Matheus Cunha, with Bryan Mbeumo possibly to follow. And Diego Leon has joined for a few extra quid.
CHECK OUT: The F365 transfer rumour power ranking

6) Atalanta – £68m
Ivan Juric has somehow landed the Atalanta job and has brought Kamaldeen Sulemana with him from Southampton.

5) Brighton – £69m
Maxim De Cuyper has propelled the Seagulls into the top five biggest spenders.

4) Real Madrid – £101.4m
They had already dropped £50m on Dean Huijsen and £8.5m on a few weeks of Trent Alexander-Arnold before they agreed to sign man-child Franco Mastantuono for an awful lot of money.

3) Manchester City – £109.6m
That’s the price of a Rayan Ait-Nouri from Wolves, a Rayan Cherki from Lyon and a Tijanji Reijnders from AC Milan, and all of them feel like bargains. Pep Guardiola wanted Florian Wirtz but he will eventually cost more on his own.

2) Liverpool – £194.5m
Florian Wirtz has cost an initial £100m (yes, it could rise to £116m but we’re not worried about add-ons on this particular list) and Jeremie Frimpong has cost £29.5m. We have also added the £25m on Giorgi Mamardashvili as that transfer will be counted in this summer’s accounts. And now Milos Kerkez has joined for a cool £40m.

1) Chelsea – £210.6m
They were the top spenders in the summers of 2024, 2023 and 2022 and will be up there in 2025 thanks to pre-arranged moves for Estevao, Dario Essugo, Mamadou Sarr and Kendry Paez. Throw in the £30m signing of Liam Delap and the Blues were already making very expensive waves before they signed Joao Pedro for an initial £55m and Jamie Gittens for not much less.

headline: Every Premier League transfer and release confirmed in the summer of 2025
body: The Premier League transfer window opened on June 1 and then closed on June 10 for six days before re-opening on Monday June 16 until Deadline Day on Monday September 1.

headline: Transfer rumour power ranking: Two in, one out at Newcastle; Arsenal deal done
body: Newcastle are set to spend around £85million in the next week, while mulling over an offer for a midfielder once rated at £50million…
With so much transfer talk doing the rounds, we’re here through the summer to sift through the bullsh*t and highlight the whispers that might have some substance.
Each day we’re ranking the top 20 rumours involving Premier League clubs, the higher the link, the more likely we feel they are to become done deals.
So we start with the tittle-tattle…

20) 🔽 Benjamin Sesko – RB Leipzig to Arsenal
Arsenal, finally, appear to have chosen a lane, one that takes them to Gyokeres’ door. We would never rule out a sharp U-turn, but Sesko’s hopes of joining Arsenal this summer have never seemed as slim as they appear right now.

19) Rodrygo – Real Madrid to Arsenal
Back in the power ranking after The Athletic reported that Madrid are ‘open to selling’ the Brazilian winger, who is apparently the Gunners’ ‘dream target’ this summer. David Ornstein says Arsenal is keen, but that a transfer is unlikely if Gabriel Martinelli isn’t sold. And Madueke will certainly be cheaper.

18) Javi Guerra – Valencia to Manchester United
The Spain Under-21 midfielder has a release clause worth £87million but United – and other clubs – reckon he’s attainable for a quarter of that sum. Apparently, Guerra is ‘close’ to joining United but we’re not buying it – yet.
